p: The next challenge would be on financial limitations. In general, the cost to fully implement optics and photonics techniques in existing agriculture activities may be a burden to the owners, especially those involving sophisticated optical tools. This deterring factor may be mitigated if financial aids are provided to the owners. In this case, the government of tropical countries should set the right path by providing funds to the owners through attractive policies. For instance, a loan policy of flexible repayment based on harvest cycles is more attractive compared to one of fixed term financing since owners are now presented with flexible loans [ 232].
